channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Sorry Day
item.description:
Sunday, May 26, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Black, Yellow, Red and Blue, White, Green to recognise Sorry Day.

National Sorry Day - On 26 May 1997 the landmark ‘Bringing them Home’ report was tabled in federal parliament. ‘Bringing them Home’ is the final report of the ‘National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families’ and was conducted by the Human Rights and Equal Opportunity Commission (now called the Australian Human Rights Commission) between 1995 and 1997. On 26 May 1998, the first National Sorry Day was held to commemorate the anniversary of the report and remember the grief, suffering and injustice experienced by the stolen generations.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Monday, May 27, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit rainbow to recognise Reconciliation Week.

27 May to 3 June 2024  is National Reconciliation Week - the theme for National Reconciliation Week 2024, “Now More Than Ever”, is a reminder to all of us that no matter what, the fight for justice and the rights of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people will - and must - continue. Now more than ever, the work continues. In treaty making, in truth-telling, in understanding our history, in education, and in tackling racism. We need connection. We need respect. We need action. And we need change.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: 2024 LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, May 28, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red, Purple, Orange, Blue, Yellow and Green to support 2024 LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day.

The creation of the LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day in 2020 was the first time in history that an awareness day was formed to highlight domestic, family and intimate partner violence and abuse occurring in LGBTQ+ communities. Held annually on May 28, LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day is the only day like it in the world. What started in Australia, is now a global event with hundreds of government departments and organisations from 17 countries recognising the day.

This Light Up is organised by: LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Azerbaijani National Day
item.description:
Tuesday, May 28, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red Blue Green to recognise Azerbaijani National Day.

Azerbaijan National Day celebrates the rich culture, heritage, and values of Azerbaijan among the local community in Queensland. Through this event, we hope to strengthen the bonds of friendship and create opportunities for dialogue, collaboration, and celebration of diversity.

This Light Up is organised by: Azerbaijani National Association of Queensland INC

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Darkness to Daylight
item.description:
Wednesday, May 29, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Darkness to Daylight.

The Darkness to Daylight event is Challenge DV's flagship fundraising and awareness event which consists of a 110km overnight run, 110km monthly running challenge, and a 10km and 3km community mass-participation event. It is a month long campaign to raise much needed funds to support Domestic Violence prevention programs. https://www.darknesstodaylight.org/

At Challenge DV we're here to end domestic and family violence. Challenge DV has been partnering with organisations since 2001 to educate, advocate and empower people to end domestic and family violence.

This Light Up is organised by: Challenge DV

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Thursday, May 30, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Black Yellow Red and Blue White Green to recognise Reconciliation Week.

27 May to 3 June 2024  is National Reconciliation Week - the theme for National Reconciliation Week 2024, “Now More Than Ever”, is a reminder to all of us that no matter what, the fight for justice and the rights of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people will - and must - continue. Now more than ever, the work continues. In treaty making, in truth-telling, in understanding our history, in education, and in tackling racism. We need connection. We need respect. We need action. And we need change.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: World MS Day
item.description:
Thursday, May 30, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support World MS Day.

Each year on 30 May we celebrate the World MS day with different themes each year, chosen by Multiple Sclerosis International Federation. Around the globe MS communities raise awareness, share stories and campaign with and for everyone affected by multiple sclerosis. It is a day where we celebrate global solidarity and hope for the future.

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 65 Roses Awareness Day
item.description:
Friday, May 31, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculpturese will be lit Red to support 65 Roses Awareness Day.

Since 1960 Cystic Fibrosis Queensland has been the peak not for profit charity providing support, services and hope to people living with cystic fibrosis. Cystic Fibrosis Queensland funds research, advocates on the behalf of and delivers welfare, support, and service programs to people living with cystic fibrosis who attend Qld Health for treatment and support. Our mission is Lives unaffected by Cystic Fibrosis and we assist everyone affected by cystic fibrosis to live fuller, healthier lives. 

The month of May is our National Awareness month, with activities taking place across the country to raise funds and awareness for people living with cystic fibrosis.

This Light Up is organised by: Cystic Fibrosis Queensland

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Friday, May 31, 2024

City Hall will be lit Black Yellow Red and Blue White Green to recognise Reconciliation Week.

27 May to 3 June 2024  is National Reconciliation Week - the theme for National Reconciliation Week 2024, “Now More Than Ever”, is a reminder to all of us that no matter what, the fight for justice and the rights of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people will - and must - continue. Now more than ever, the work continues. In treaty making, in truth-telling, in understanding our history, in education, and in tackling racism. We need connection. We need respect. We need action. And we need change.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Marathon Festival
item.description:
Saturday, June 1, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue to celebrate Brisbane Marathon Festival.

Celebrating our 32nd year in 2024, the Queensland Country Bank Brisbane Marathon Festival is one of the oldest and most friendly events on the Australian calendar attracting thousands of participants from over 35 countries annually. Often labelled the "boutique" marathon of choice, in part due to the VIP treatment all participants receive. The event celebrates fun fitness and the test of ultimate human endurance – the Marathon.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Italian Independence Day
item.description:
Sunday, June 2, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to recognise Italian Independence Day.

Each year on June 2 Italy celebrates Festa della Repubblica – Italy’s National Day. It is a day that is celebrated with ceremony, colour, events and festivities.

This Light Up is organised by: Com. It. Es. Qld + NT

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Mabo Day
item.description:
Monday, June 3, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to recognise Mabo Day.

On 3 June 1992, the High Court of Australia handed down a landmark decision in the Mabo case, overturning the legal concept of terra nullius ~ land belonging to no-one. In acknowledging the traditional rights of the Meriam people to their land, the court also held that native title existed for all Indigenous people, paving the way for new federal legislation the following year, the Native Title Act 1993.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

In acknowledging the traditional rights of the Meriam people to their land, the court also held that native title existed for all Indigenous people, paving the way for new federal legislation the following year, the Native Title Act 1993.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: World Haemochromatosis Week - Lighten the Overload
item.description:
Tuesday, June 4, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red to support World Haemochromatosis Week - Lighten the Overload.

‘Lighten the Overload’ is an annual event raising awareness of haemochromatosis around the world.
Haemochromatosis or iron overload is serious and results from the incorrect uptake, processing and storage of dietary iron within the body. It can cause liver cirrhosis, liver cancer, arthritis and diabetes. Haemochromatosis is Australia's most common genetic disorder but few in the community are aware of it. About one in 200 people have the genetic pre-disposition for haemochromatosis and additionally, one in 7 people are carriers of the gene that causes it. The annual event raises awareness of haemochromatosis around the world, and the work of the Haemochromatosis Australia - a non-profit registered charity run entirely by volunteers. We are the support and advocacy group for people affected by haemochromatosis, their families and loved ones. We aim to provide support for people with the disorder and to increase awareness of haemochromatosis in the general public and the medical and health professions. We have been operating for over 30 years and continue to grow and expand our activities.

This Light Up is organised by: Haemochromatosis Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: State of Origin - Game I Sydney
item.description:
Wednesday, June 5, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Maroon to celebrate State of Origin - Game I Sydney.

Australia’s greatest sporting rivalry is back, with the 2024 Ampol State of Origin Series kicking off on Wednesday, 5 June at Accor Stadium, Sydney. The Maroons are riding a wave of back-to-back Series wins, however the Blues enter 2024 with a new coach and scores to settle. State of Origin returns to Melbourne for the first time since 20I8, with the iconic MCG playing host to a Game II blockbuster with the series concluding at Suncorp Stadium for Game III.
 
Make sure you’re there to experience real rivalry live.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Queensland Day
item.description:
Thursday, June 6, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Maroon to recognise Queensland Day.

This Queensland Day, Monday 6 June 2024, marks 165 years since Queensland separated from New South Wales to become an independent colony on 6 June 1859.

Commemorated annually, Queensland Day is an important celebration of our state’s culture and heritage and an opportunity to reflect on what Queensland means to you. It is an opportunity for businesses, community groups, organisations, schools, sporting teams and families to come together and share their state pride.

This Light Up is organised by: The Department of Premier and Cabinet

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Go Green for EcoMarines
item.description:
Friday, June 7, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to support Go Green for EcoMarines.

EcoMarines Foundation educates young people and businesses on the impacts of everyday activities on their local landscapes, freshwater systems and local and downstream marine environments and their wildlife, and provides guidance to help them fight pollution and other negative human impacts in their local area to protect and save those environments and wildlife.

This Light Up is organised by: Tangalooma EcoMarines Foundation

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
item.description:
Saturday, June 8, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Teal to support 2024 Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month.

 Take a moment to reflect on your myasthenia journey. Capture the image and share so myasthenia can gain more awareness in the community. This will help research. This will help you with your myasthenia journey.
"Queensland Lights Up for Myasthenia" celebrates International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month.

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2024 Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
item.description:
Saturday, June 8, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Teal to support 2024 Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month.

 Take a moment to reflect on your myasthenia journey. Capture the image and share so myasthenia can gain more awareness in the community. This will help research. This will help you with your myasthenia journey.
"Queensland Lights Up for Myasthenia" celebrates International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month.

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: Tourette Syndrome Awareness Week
item.description:
Saturday, June 8, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures  will be lit Teal to support Tourette Syndrome Awareness Week.

Tourette Syndrome Association of Australia supports people with Tourette Syndrome (1 in 100 people) and aims to increase awareness of the disability among medical practitioners, public utilities and the general public. The activities of the TSAA Awareness Week are all geared towards achieving our goals of: Supporting people with Tourette Syndrome and their families, Gathering and circulating information regarding Tourette Syndrome and available forms of treatment; Circulating information regarding Tourette Syndrome to doctors, schools and other interested parties; Gaining publicity through the media and other outlets about Tourette Syndrome; and Raising funds for research into the causes and cure of Tourette Syndrome and to assist in the achievement of the above activities.

This Light Up is organised by: Tourette Syndrome Association of Australia 

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Hidradenitis Suppurativa Awareness Week
item.description:
Sunday, June 9, 2024

City Hall will be lit Purple to support Hidradenitis Suppurativa Awareness Week.

Hidradenitis Suppurativa is a chronic skin condition characterized by painful, inflamed lesions typically occurring in areas where skin rubs together, such as the armpits, groin, and buttocks. Hidradenitis Suppurativa Australia (HSA) is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting individuals in Australia who suffer from Hidradenitis Suppurativa and aims to raise awareness about HS, provide support and resources to those affected, and advocate for improved healthcare services and research funding for the condition. 

Illuminating up the country purple is about raising awareness, educating the public, healthcare professionals, and policymakers about HS to improve understanding, reduce stigma, and promote early diagnosis.

This Light Up is organised by: Hidradenitis Suppurativa Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Australian National Swimming Trials
item.description:
Monday, June 10, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Australian National Swimming Trials.

The Brisbane Aquatic Centre will host the 2024 Australian Trials from 10-15 June. The Australian Trials rank as the most prestigious domestic swimming event in the national calendar and the 2024 Trials will serve as the sole selection meet for the Dolphins Swimming Team to compete in Paris.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of Philippines Independence Day
item.description:
Tuesday, June 11, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to recognise Eve of Philippines Independence Day.

The Philippine Declaration of Independence was proclaimed on June 12 1898. Today the Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Incorporated would like to reach out Brisbane and its Filipino-Australians, and all residents to join together to celebrate the Philippines 126th Independence Day.

This Light Up is organised by: The Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Incorporated

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Thank a First Responder Day
item.description:
Wednesday, June 12, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Teal to support Thank a First Responder Day.

Fortem provides an array of mental health and wellbeing services to first responders and their families in order to nurture their resilience and keep them in their roles. June 12, 2024, is ‘Thank a First Responder Day’, a day when Fortem asks all Australians to say thank you to the 300,000+ first responders who dedicate their lives to helping others. In addition to encouraging everyone to say thanks, we seek to light up the buildings and monuments that have deep meaning for Australians on the evening of Wednesday, June 12 with the colour teal.

This Light Up is organised by: Fortem Australia Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

June 12, 2024, is ‘Thank a First Responder Day’, a day when Fortem asks all Australians to say thank you to the 300,000+ first responders who dedicate their lives to helping others. In addition to encouraging everyone to say thanks, we seek to light up the buildings and monuments that have deep meaning for Australians on the evening of Wednesday, June 12 with the colour teal.
This Light Up is organised by: Fortem Australia Ltd

item.title: Budgie Bolt
item.description:
Thursday, June 13, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Budgie Bolt.

The Budgie Bolt is back bigger and better, and we want YOU to take flight with us! Join us on Sunday 16 June at New Farm Park. Hundreds of Youngcare supporters will wheel, walk or run 5km in their budgie smugglers, Budgie Bolt merch or your most extravagant red costume to raise funds and awareness for young Australians with complex physical disabilities. Why? To raise much needed funds to create freedom, dignity and choice for young Australians with high physical support needs who are being left behind.

This Light Up is organised by: Youngcare Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Big Freeze 10 - The Mini Freeze
item.description:
Friday, June 14, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue to support Big Freeze 10 - The Mini Freeze.

Founded in 2014, FightMND was established with the purpose of finding effective treatments and ultimately a cure for Motor Neurone Disease.

The Big Freeze 10 aims to shine a light on the battle being fought by thousands of people across Australia who are diagnosed with MND, as currently there are no viable treatments and no cure for MND. Part of the Big Freeze 10 , the Mini Freeze will be during the Brisbane Lions vs St Kilda game on Friday 14 June.  Lighting up monuments around the country in our Big Freeze Blue aims to fund essential research and eventually make MND a thing of the past, but also, its an incredible display of solidarity and support for those in the MND community who have died, been diagnosed, or are currently fighting their battle against the Beast.

This Light Up is organised by: FightMND

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Elder Abuse Awareness Day
item.description:
Saturday, June 15, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support World Elder Abuse Awareness Day.

The Department of Child Safety, Seniors and Disability Services would like to support World Elder Abuse Awareness Day (WEAAD), a global initiative to raise awareness of elder abuse and neglect on June 15. Learn about the definition, prevalence, and impact of elder abuse, and how to prevent it. WEAAD provides an opportunity for communities around the world to promote a better understanding of abuse and neglect of older persons by raising awareness of the cultural, social, economic and demographic processes affecting elder abuse and neglect.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Child Safety, Seniors and Disability Services & Caxton Community Legal Centre

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
